entries.title: Ubisoft workers plan strike over CEO email about dismal losses
entries.description: The video game company's CEO emailed workers about dire financial results, saying “the ball is in your court to deliver.” Employees intend to strike in response.

entries.title: Microsoft to cut 10,000 jobs as wave of layoffs sweeps tech industry
entries.description: The job cuts were announced Wednesday by Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

entries.title: The perfect escape: What goes into designing cozy life sim games
entries.description: Cozy game designers zero in on the repetitive but sometimes soul-nurturing reality of our lives and amplify it.

entries.title: Twitter auctions office equipment, coffee machines as Musk slims company
entries.description: The social media giant, which Musk bought for $44 billion, is taking a novel approach to raising funds by auctioning items from its San Francisco headquarters.

entries.title: ChatGPT could make life easier — here’s when it’s worth it
entries.description: The groundbreaking AI chat bot from OpenAI comes with ethical snares — even for people at home.

entries.title: Crypto is back — in Davos, at least — as redemption tour rolls on
entries.description: The World Economic Forum’s gathering in Davos has become an unlikely destination for the crypto industry as it tries to raise its profile — and new funds.

entries.title: University of Texas at Austin bans TikTok from its networks
entries.description: Citing a directive from Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, the university said it was blocking the social media app owned by Chinese tech giant ByteDance.
